Converts variables and Godot variants into binary and vice-versa. HLBuffer is the medium of storage.

ProtocolRegistry

The singleton instance of the ProtocolRegistry. This is used to serialize and deserialize scenes, network properties, and network functions sent across the network. The point is that we can't send an entire scene string across the network or some other lengthy identifier because it would take up too much bandwidth. So we use this to classify scenes as bytes which can be sent across the network, using minimal bandwidth. The same goes for network properties and functions. See ProtocolRegistry.Build for more information.

ProtocolRegistry.MethodName

Cached StringNames for the methods contained in this class, for fast lookup.

ProtocolRegistry.PropertyName

Cached StringNames for the properties and fields contained in this class, for fast lookup.

ProtocolRegistry.SignalName

Cached StringNames for the signals contained in this class, for fast lookup.

ProtocolRegistryBuilder

This extension of ProtocolRegistry is used for generating the ProtocolResource.

Cached StringNames for the methods contained in this class, for fast lookup.

Cached StringNames for the properties and fields contained in this class, for fast lookup.

ProtocolRegistryBuilder.SignalName

Cached StringNames for the signals contained in this class, for fast lookup.

ProtocolResource

A resource that contains the compiled data of a ProtocolRegistry. This resource defines the bytes used to encode and decode network scenes, nodes, properties, and functions, as well as the lookup tables used to quickly find the corresponding data. With this compiled resource, the program is able to understand how to send and receive game state.

ProtocolResource.MethodName

Cached StringNames for the methods contained in this class, for fast lookup.

ProtocolResource.PropertyName

Cached StringNames for the properties and fields contained in this class, for fast lookup.

ProtocolResource.SignalName

Cached StringNames for the signals contained in this class, for fast lookup.

SerialMetadata

This resource is used to extend Godot's Variant type, particularly for the types sent across the network for ProtocolNetProperty and ProtocolNetFunction. The purpose is to have additional information at runtime about how the data should be encoded and decoded without using reflection. We can't depend on Godot's variant alone, as the provided types in Variant.Type are not detailed enough.

The value used for the TypeIdentifier comes from the ProtocolRegistry.SerialTypeIdentifiers dictionary, which itself is populated at compile time by the SerialTypeIdentifier attribute.

SerialMetadata.MethodName

Cached StringNames for the methods contained in this class, for fast lookup.

SerialMetadata.PropertyName

Cached StringNames for the properties and fields contained in this class, for fast lookup.

SerialMetadata.SignalName

Cached StringNames for the signals contained in this class, for fast lookup.
